review_text:
The apartment worked well for us: good location, very well equipped kitchen, and surprisingly quiet given the age of the building and number of units. Steve and Betty were accommodating and gave us an early check-in.
Overall, it was a good place to stay for the week while we did some work on our house nearby. However, there was some chipping lead paint which is not great for children; the sheets on one of the bed were tattered and had big holes; some of the storms are not up and so the space between the windows (which are filled with debris and some insects) are open to the living space; and last, there's a bench with some outdoor cushions that was not comfortable to sit on. If not for these few items, it would be a perfect place to stay.

Great location! Right by Walmart and Westwood Mall.
Very clean! And great amenities! Also, the available food was really convenient! They had a Keurig, tea, hot chocolate, breakfast sandwiches, muffins, and popcorn available, as well as actually having more than just salt and pepper for spices. They had ear plugs if you aren't used to cars driving by, little space heaters, a good supply of bathroom items.
It is a very cute place, and Steve and Betty are doing a great job.
Parking was fine in my midsize pick-up. I recommend backing into the space.
The shower/water takes a while to heat up, but this, as well as working the old radiators, is clearly explained in their instructions.
I will probably stay here again next time I'm visiting! Loved it!

name: Tsz-Ming
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
April 2022
,
Â·
Stayed over a week
review_text: one bedroom apartment in a 100 year-old building. The best part of this experience were the hosts who proactively checked in on me throughout my stay, which I had never experienced anywhere else and is deeply appreciated. Their amenities such as big fluffy towels and comfortable bedding made the place more home than the average Airbnb. It is located along a busy intersection. Getting a pair of soft ear plugs is a must if you want good quality sleep at night. The biggest challenge was the heating system that is old style central not thermostat control. There were extended periods of time without heat despite me having turned on the heaters to max. I understand this is a historical building, but I also lived in 100+ years old buildings back East and never had to shiver in bed with indoor temperatures in the 50s and low 60s. On a positive note, it gave me new-found appreciation for modern technology and central heat/cooling when I finally returned home. In the end, the hosts are so nice and communicative that were what made this stay memorable.

The only thing to be aware of is that you can hear EVERYTHING the people in the apartment above are doing. it sounds like they have kids because there's pretty much constant running, vacuuming, moving things around, just regular living. it was manageable for a short stay but I could see how it could drive someone crazy after awhile. other than that, it's a good spot and the beds are super comfy.

My neighbors were not making excessive noise, but you can hear any footstep, and you can hear voices even at a normal conversation sound level. I am a heavy sleeper so it was no problem for me, but it might be for some. Overall, a great stay that met all my needs. Thank you, Steve and Betty!

If they would have stated that the lodging would have a very strong fruity fragrance, I would not have made the reservation.
I understand advertising the property in the best light, but these are things a proprietor should be honest about.
Also, noise from the occupants of the floor above included vacuuming, and children's voices, loud thumps and bumps - during the hour (9:45-10:45) that we tried to sleep. Then we got up and left.
I am sorry, but I will not trust this superhost again.

name: Traci
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
May 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Steve & Betty's place is comfortable and spacious, impeccably clean & cozy. It's tastefully decorated, the bathroom is cute and totally appreciate the dispensers in the shower, much more eco-friendly than trial size bottles. Also plenty of fluffy towels and bedding.
The neighborhood is quiet but it is right near a busy street so there is traffic noise during the day. In warm weather when the window air conditioners are running you don't hear it. It's within easy walking distance of downtown with lots of restaurants and shops.
The little side parking lot has a concrete driveway so it's easy to miss if you arrive after dark. Kudos to the hosts for the detailed directions and instructions. They were also lightning fast to respond to messages.
Definitely would stay here again if I'm back in town, thanks Steve & Betty!

name: Grant
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
August 2021
,
Â·
Group trip
review_text: Nice roomy place that took us back to our college days -- reminded us a lot of the off-campus housing we used to live in (urban setting, older building, etc.). Our family was able to comfortably spread out in this space. The set up that you can't see in the pictures was a little strange -- you enter in the dining room (seats 6 comfortably), move into the living room (Disney Plus subscription was a plus for our son! Games in the closet as well), then walk down the long hallway, passing two bedrooms to the back of the place where the bathroom, and finally the kitchen are located. The kitchen has two additional chairs and a small table. We used the chairs in the dining room, and walked our food down the hallway and through the living room to eat in the dining room. As a family, we tend to eat in, and the kitchen had a few gaps which we were able to creatively fill (lack of sufficient pots and pans). Otherwise it was fully stocked with a Keurig and an assortment of coffees and teas as well as some breakfast items in the cupboard and the freezer. Overall, we had a comfortable stay (the air conditioning was a plus on a VERY hot weekend, and found the hosts to be very helpful with tips along the way.

I only have 2 complaints out of the whole stay and 1 is not their fault in the slightest but I feel it should be said so others would know. You can not control the heater at all. The first night we were there I could not sleep because it was so hot. Probably close to 85Â°F if I were to guess. I had to open a window so I could get airflow. They do have a portable air conditioner in there and the next day I cut it all the way down to 64 just to get the place down to 76Â°F.
The second thing is that the mattresses were hard. Might just be a preference thing. But I like my mattress to be a little more on the softer side.
Besides those 2 things, the place is amazing. Convenient location. Literally minutes from a Walmart. So much to do in Jackson. Love the antique vibe.

Very hot apartment even in chilly weather.
I failed to notice the reviews for the heat issues, or would have second guessed booking.
There was nothing wrong with the accommodations, except the temperature.
The building has central boiler heat system and canâ€™t be controlled in this apartment. I noticed an AC unit when we came in but didnâ€™t think about it until I noticed how warm it was even with it running.
It was unbearably hot- the ac unit couldnâ€™t keep up and the fans just circulated warm air which made for a sleep deprived night.
if you like the warmth, itâ€™s a super cute place and I think they are trying to work on a solution.
This would have been a 5 star review based solely on the fact that they are very responsive hosts and accommodated a request before we arrived and were very willing to try to work with us to resolve the issues.

Stayed with kids
review_text: This is the third property of Steve & Betty's I've stayed at, and all have been great stays! I loved the modern look of the space. One thing to note is that this unit is heated by radiant heat from a steam boiler, so you can't do much to control the temp. I noticed that as the temp dropped outside, the apt got a lot warmer, as I assume the steam boiler worked harder to heat the apt building. So if you're someone that gets hot easily, staying here in the colder months may be uncomfortable for you. Other than that, the apt was awesome and I look forward to more stays with them. Great locations, great value, and great service from hosts!

pros:
- easy access to apartment, no key needed
- ac in the bedroom cooled the whole apartment and wasn't loud
- extra toiletries under the bathroom sink (deodorant for men and women, tooth brushes, toothpaste, etc)
- provided snacks (muffins, popcorn and oatmeal) and drinks (coffee and tea pods, tea bags and hot cocoa)
cons:
- mattress in bedroom was hard and not comfortable
- wifi was not reliable, kept disconnecting when inside but was slightly better when outside the building
recommendations:
- throw blanket/s for the couch
- cotton balls/rounds and qtips for bathroom
overall this was a good Airbnb, was across the street from Walmart and a mall which was useful, exactly as described and met our expectations, I would choose another Airbnb from them again :)

review_text:
We came for a weekend and arrived in the middle of a winter storm. This place has covered parking! What a godsend for this stay. We could walk to an Applebees maybe a quarter mile so no driving in the blizzard. The neighborhood is nice and felt safe.
The place was perfect for us. The bed was comfy, coffee service was great with a Keurig and plenty of pods, and the TV worked easily . We could not get Netflix to work for some reason, but Hulu and Tubi were both available so all good, along with network tv.
The day after the storm was good and we made dinner reservations at Veritas in the very cute downtown area, only a drive of just over a mile, easily walkable in the summer. It was a fantastic restaurant, steak and seafood, full bar, live music while we were there. Lots of other cute looking places down there too.
We would love to come back when there is no blizzard!

Or just sit out and relax and watch the sunset - the views are wonderful. The owner is very attentive and helpful. I hope to return again soon.
